text:
e="preserve">The Regional Representative Council (, DPD; alternatively translatable as the House of Regions or the House of Regional Representatives or the Senate of Indonesia'"), is one of two parliamentary chambers in Indonesia.
With the "Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat," (DPR'"), it makes up the Indonesian national legislative body, the "Majelis Permusyawaratan Rakyat" (MPR).
Under Indonesia's constitution, the authority of the DPD is limited to areas related to regional governments and can only propose and give advise on bills to the DPR.
